name: sparse_fo_rev
brief:
Bit-pattern propagation for sparsity detection

Provides forward and reverse mode interfaces that propagate bit patterns
instead of numerical values. Used to efficiently determine the sparsity
structure of Jacobian and Hessian matrices.

Bit patterns are packed into size_t words for efficiency. For n independent
variables, the seed matrix X[n][p] uses p = ceil(n / bits_per_long) words
per row, where bits_per_long = 8 * sizeof(size_t).

Two modes:
- **Tight**: Uses actual values x[] during propagation (more accurate)
- **Safe**: Uses only bit patterns (faster, may overestimate sparsity)
see: sparse/sparsedrivers.h for high-level sparse derivative computation
